sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An ansvvere to a supplicatorie epistle, of G.T. for the pretended Catholiques written to the right Honorable Lords of her Maiesties priuy Councell. By VVater [sic] Trauers, minister of the worde of God. Travers, Walter, 1547 or 8-1635.
[4], 96, 102-133, 129-160, 177-256, 237-252, 273-288, 269-300, 321-400, [8] p.
Printed [by John Wolfe, Robert Waldegrave, and others?] for Tobie Smith, dwelling in Paules Church-yard at the signe of the Crane, At London : [1583]
A response to the first part of: Parsons, Robert. An epistle of the persecution of Catholickes in England. "Wolfe pr[inted]. quires A-G; K, R, T, U, Aa are signed in Waldegrave's manner. Other pr[inter]s. or compositors are responsible for the tp, H, I; M-O; L, P, Q, S, X-Z, Bb, Cc"--STC. The first leaf is blank. Running title reads: An answere to a popish treatise vvritten to the LL. of the Councell. With three final errata leaves; the last leaf is blank. Identified as STC 24182 on UMI microfilm. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

Running title reads: An answere to a popish treatise vvritten to the LL. of the Councell. With three final errata leaves; the last leaf is blank. Identified as STC 24182 on UMI microfilm. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
